properties.name: activateRowOnHover
properties.description:
Toggle row active state on mouse enter/leave (hover)

Default: false
properties.rawdescription:
Toggle row active state on mouse enter/leave (hover)

**Default:** `false`

properties.name: activateRowOnKeyboardNavigation
properties.description:
Toggle row active state on keyboard navigation

Default: false
properties.rawdescription:
Toggle row active state on keyboard navigation

**Default:** `false`

properties.name: class
properties.description:
Add one or more CSS classes to the table element e.g. table table-striped table-bordered.

Default: table
properties.rawdescription:
Add one or more CSS classes to the table element e.g. `table table-striped table-bordered`.

**Default:** `table`

properties.name: disableTableSort
properties.description:
Disable sorting of table data, useful when sorting is handled externally e.g. server-side pagination. Table will still use sortOrder to visually show how the data is sorted.

Default: false
properties.rawdescription:
Disable sorting of table data, useful when sorting is handled externally e.g. server-side pagination. Table will still use sortOrder to visually show how the data is sorted.

**Default:** `false`

properties.name: mobileLayout
properties.description:
Allows for a more mobile friendly layout by displaying columns as rows instead. This is accomplished with css by adding table-mobile class to table element and adding column headers as data labels to each row.

Default: false
properties.rawdescription:
Allows for a more mobile friendly layout by displaying columns as rows instead. This is accomplished with css by adding `table-mobile` class to table element and adding column headers as data labels to each row.

**Default:** `false`

properties.name: stickyHeaders
properties.description:
Make row and/or column headers sticky by adding gt-sticky-row-header and gt-sticky-column-header to table to alter table behaviour using css. Please note that in order for headers to be sticky, table can't be placed inside element with overflow set to auto.

Default: {row:false, column:false}
properties.rawdescription:
Make row and/or column headers sticky by adding `gt-sticky-row-header` and `gt-sticky-column-header` to table to alter table behaviour using css. Please note that in order for headers to be sticky, table can't be placed inside element with overflow set to auto.

**Default:** `{row:false, column:false}`

components.name: AppComponent

propertiesClass.name: data$

components.templateData: Example

components.name: CoreComponent

jsdoctags.comment: An object that contains custom classes for various elements in the table.
• { selectedRow: string, activeRow: string } - default classes are 'gt-selected' and 'gt-active'
Whether or not to generate a unique id for each row in the table. Defaults to true.
Function to determine if row is selected or not.
A function that receives a row object and optional state for current selection that can be used to determine if row should be marked as selected or not.
An array of keyboard keys that will trigger navigation and active row, currently only supports arrow keys, home and end (omit key name from array to disable it)
row key to use as unique id for table row. If passed, table won't generate unique ids for each row but instead use key to retrieve unique id from row.
An object that contains the currently selected row(s) in the table. It's passed to the selection function to determine which rows should be selected.
An array of keyboard keys that will trigger row selection (omit key name from array to disable it)
A function that returns a unique identifier for each row in the table to optimize rendering when data is added or removed.
• TrackByFunction to retrieve unique id based on index and/or row. Defaults to using row[this.rowIdKey].

outputsClass.name: pageChange
outputsClass.rawdescription: page change event - emitted when current page/index changes for pagination
outputsClass.description: page change event - emitted when current page/index changes for pagination

propertiesClass.name: _pagingInfo$
calculations$
propertiesClass.defaultValue:
combineLatest([this.data$, this.tableConfig$]).pipe(
    map(([data, config]) => calculate(data, config)),
    shareReplay(1)
  )

propertiesClass.name: colspan$
currentPaginationIndex$
data$
footerColspan$
rowActive$
searchBy$
propertiesClass.defaultValue:
this._searchBy$.pipe(
    startWith(''),
    map((value) => (isObservable(value) ? value : of(value))),
    switchMap((obs) => obs),
    shareReplay(1)
  )

propertiesClass.name: table$
tableConfig$
propertiesClass.defaultValue:
this._tableConfig$.pipe(
    map((value) => (isObservable(value) ? value : of(value))),
    switchMap((obs) => obs),
    tap((config) => (this._tableConfig = config)),
    shareReplay(1)
  )

jsdoctags.comment: classes that should be used within pagination component for different elements
• classes to be used. Defaults to: { ul: 'pagination', li: 'page-item', button: 'page-link', }
number of buttons to show in pagination
• number of buttons to show. Defaults to: 5
when provided, pagination component will use this information to render pagination instead of data from table. Use this option when pagination is handled by backend (server side).
• metadata for pagination component

• table component

components.name: RowSelectComponent

propertiesClass.name: config$
data$
propertiesClass.defaultValue:
this.http
    .get<{ data: TableRow[] }>(
      'https://private-730c61-generictable.apiary-mock.com/data'
    )
    .pipe(
      pluck('data'),
      tap((_) => this.loading$.next(false)),
      takeUntil(this.unsubscribe$),
      shareReplay(1)
    )
